tasks.title: Character creation works without domain-specific errors
Narrative Engine functions as standalone module
Required attribution in all SRD files
Git pre-commit hook for automated checking
Integration layer refactoring (universal vs game-specific fields)
Memory layer architecture (episodic, semantic, procedural, emotional)
Live character sheet with real-time updates
**LLM-Powered Extraction**: Uses Ollama llama3 for semantic understanding
**Multi-Fact Extraction**: Name, race, class, background, age, gender, alignment, personality
**Immediate Fact Commitment**: No staging, direct character sheet updates
**Live Character Sheet**: Real-time updates as player describes character
**Robust Fallback**: Pattern matching when LLM extraction fails
**Guided Completion**: Intelligent transition to guided questions only when ambiguous
**Point Buy**: 27-point system with official cost chart
**Roll 4d6 Drop Lowest**: Official SRD 5.2 rolling method
**Character Sheet Rendering**: Clear display with modifiers
**Inspiration Points**: Set/get inspiration points for characters
**Session Persistence**: Save/load campaign and character data
**Memory Integration**: Episodic, semantic, emotional memory flows
**Domain-Agnostic Core**: Clean separation from game-specific logic
**Integration Layer**: Proper universal vs domain-specific field separation
**Memory Layer Architecture**: Episodic, semantic, procedural, emotional
**Symbolic Processing**: Archetype detection and pattern recognition
**Goal Inference**: Automatic narrative goal detection and tracking
**Attribution Requirements**: Required text in all SRD files
**Restricted Content**: No proprietary SRD publisher IP
**Automated Compliance**: Git pre-commit hook and CLI audit tool
**Copyright Law**: Proper attribution and content separation
**5E-Compatible**: Not affiliated with or endorsed by SRD publisher
**License Files**: Full Creative Commons license included
**LLM Integration**: Ollama llama3 with fallback support
**API Endpoints**: RESTful API for all game functions
**Session Management**: Campaign and character state persistence
**Mobile Responsive**: Works on desktop and mobile
**TNB Integration**: Clean handoff through Narrative Bridge
**TNE Integration**: Symbolic processing and memory management
**LLM Provider Abstraction**: Modular LLM backend support
**Modular Boundaries**: Clean separation between demo layer and core systems
**Domain-Agnostic Design**: Narrative Engine core remains reusable
**Integration Layer**: Proper universal vs domain-specific field handling
**Error Handling**: Graceful degradation and user-friendly error messages
**API Testing**: All endpoints tested and working
**Character Creation**: LLM extraction and fallback tested
**Game Mechanics**: Inspiration points and saving throws tested
**Response Times**: Acceptable performance for all operations
**UI Polish**: Improve responsive design and user experience
**Error Resilience**: Enhance error handling and recovery
**Additional Game Mechanics**: Implement more D&D 5E features
**Enhanced Memory Visualization**: Improve memory flow display
**Goal Tracking Enhancement**: Better goal inference and tracking
**Core Features**: All major features implemented and tested
**Domain-Agnostic Integrity**: Narrative Engine core remains reusable
**SRD 5.2 Compliance**: All content properly attributed and separated
**Modular Architecture**: Clean boundaries between demo layer and core systems
**Performance**: Acceptable response times for all operations
**Game Mechanics**: Working D&D 5E mechanics (ability scores, inspiration, saving throws)
**Error Handling**: Graceful failure modes and user-friendly messages
Points to the correct active LLM (e.g., `GEMMA_API_URL=http://localhost:1234/v1`)
Contains no references to Ollama unless specifically required
Has entries for bridge and engine endpoints if needed
App starts via `python3 simple_unified_interface.py` with no warnings
No file in SoloHeart imports from `narrative_engine` or `narrative_bridge` directly
tasks.description: _(Only interface through configured endpoints or bridge methods)_

tasks.title: No class, method, or file name in TNE/TNB includes the term `soloheart`
All symbolic logic is processed via TNE, not locally in the UI layer
Player input is successfully routed to TNB and TNE
Memory entries are returned, tagged with types (episodic, emotional, etc.)
Goal inference returns correctly and populates UI fields
Confidence indicators and timestamps appear on goals (if implemented)
Memory entries degrade or evolve over multiple turns (if decay is active)
Character creation form accepts and forwards freeform input
Vibe code entry maps to a generated character sheet via TNE logic
No hardcoded story paths are used during or after character creation
Input reflects modular symbolic parsing (e.g., tags, tokens, goal alignment)
Player input is shown in a dedicated pane or stream
LLM responses are clearly marked and separated from player text
Memory entries appear in a scrollable, filterable panel
Goals inferred from input are displayed with symbolic or confidence indicators
`.env` switching between LLMs functions as expected:
Ollama fallback (if enabled) does not hijack symbolic logic
Provider abstraction layer logs which backend is in use
No LLM-specific hacks or bypass logic is present in the UI
`ollama_provider.py` and fallback logic are removed or archived
No scripted roleplay modules exist (e.g., "scene1_fallback.py", etc.)
If the LLM is offline or errors out:
UI shows graceful failure message (not a traceback)
Player is prompted to retry or check system status
If TNE or TNB is offline:
UI disables further input and logs issue
`soloheart_pivot_audit.md` correctly labels Archived / Merged / Kept assets
README clearly states that this project is a **demo layer for The Narrative Engine**
All logs, errors, and system messages reflect the new modular purpose
All interaction flows demonstrate symbolic interpretation and goal tracking
The system is ready to be presented as a clean, maintainable **Narrative Engine demo layer**
